intro: Pyankovia, commonly known as the Pyankovia plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Pyankovia species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where they thrive in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value, some species are cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
